The large majority of the recorded plants are used in form of teas, and mainly for minor dysfunctions of the respiratory system, in a form of medicinal herbs. These herbs have a potential to involve local collectors , mainly individuals and families from the region of Maleshevija. With these efforts there is a potential to create employment opportunity thereby, helping in decreasing poverty and increasing empowerment of particularly women. The Maleshevski mountain offers very good condition for further development of NTFP, including medicinal herbs. Medicinal herbs, as a NTFP product, have a big potential in the region of Maleshevija. This product has a good potential to involve local collectors through clear tenured rights, better collection methods, capacity development, infrastructure and institutional support in near future. The Maleshevski mountain offers very good condition for further development of berries.   Harvesting is often done in a non-sustainable manner, careless about the resource, one due to the lack of training, and second due to the competition among harvesters to get quantity over quality. Buyout values quantity and rarely quality. It is raised concerns regarding the possibility of over exploitation of a few species due to collecting practices serving both local and outside (pharmaceutical) markets.
